title: The Groac-h of the Isle of Lok

events.description: The story begins with two young people, Houarn and Bellah, living in the countryside. They are both poor and have no prospects for the future. One day, they hear about a beautiful fairy who lives on an island in the sea. The fairy has a magical net that can turn anyone into anything she wants, and she uses it to lure men to her island with promises of wealth and happiness. Houarn and Bellah decide to go to the island to try their luck.

When they arrive on the island, they are met by the fairy, who is even more beautiful than they had imagined. She invites them to stay on the island and promises to make them rich and happy if they will marry her. Houarn and Bellah agree, but as soon as the ceremony is over, the fairy turns them into fish. They are thrown into a pond with many other men who have been turned into fish by the fairy.

Bellah manages to escape from the island and finds a tiny man in a nest on top of a rock. He tells her that he is the husband of the fairy and has been imprisoned there by her magic. Bellah agrees to help him, and together they come up with a plan to rescue Houarn and the other men.

Bellah dresses up as a young man and goes to the island to confront the fairy. She manages to get hold of the net that hangs from the fairy's waist and uses it to turn her into a toad. The fairy is then thrown into a pit, and Bellah uses the magic knife to restore Houarn and the other men to their proper shapes.

The little dwarf who was imprisoned in the nest on top of the rock appears, and he leads them down into the caves filled with gold and jewels. He tells them that they can take as much treasure as they want, but Bellah and Houarn are content with just a small amount. They order their stick to become a winged carriage, and it takes them back to Lanillis, where they get married the next day.
The story ends with Bellah and Houarn living happily ever after, surrounded by the men they had rescued from the fairy's island.
